==Breton== ===Etymology=== Cognate with {{cog|cy|cefn|t=back}}, {{cog|kw|keyn|t=back}}, {{cog|cel-gau|Cebenna||ridge, height}} (whence {{cog|fr|-}} {{w|Cévennes}}), ultimately from {{inh|br|cel-pro|*kebno-||back}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|br|/ˈkɛjn/}} ===Noun=== {{br-noun|m|p=keinoù}} # [[back]] (the rear of body) ====Inflection==== {{br-noun-mutation|k|ein|einoù|g=m}} ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|kein}}, from the merger of {{inh|de|gmh|dechein}}, {{m|gmh|dehein}} {{gloss|"someone; anyone", from {{inh|de|goh|dehein}}}} and {{inh|de|gmh|nechein}}, {{m|gmh|nehein}} {{gloss|"not any", from {{inh|de|goh|nihein}}}}. More at {{l|en|none}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/kaɪ̯n/}} * {{audio|de|De-kein.ogg|Audio}} * {{rhymes|de|aɪ̯n}} * {{homophones|de|Kain}} * {{homophones|de|keinen}} {{a|according to a common pronunciation of this form}} ===Pronoun=== {{head|de|pronoun}} # [[no]]; [[not]] a(n); not one; not any #: ''Das ist '''kein''' Bett.'' — “That is not a bed.” (Compare with: “That is no bed.”) ====Declension==== The declension pattern for {{m|de|kein}} follows that of {{m|de|ein||a}} and the possessive determiners, as does the declension of adjectives that follow {{m|de|kein}}. For the most part, the adjectives decline like those that appear after the definite article (the so-called ''weak declension pattern'' for German adjectives). However, {{m|de|kein}} lacks a masculine marker in the nominative case and a neuter marker in the nominative and accusative cases. Accordingly, adjectives following that plain form take an {{m|de|-er}} or {{m|de|-es}} to indicate the gender: {{de-decl-kein}} ====Related terms==== * {{l|de|keiner}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} ---- ==West Frisian== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|fy|ofs|*kēne}}, from {{inh|fy|gem-pro|*kōniz|t=brave}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{a|Clay}} {{IPA|fy|/kai̯n/}} * {{a|Wood}} {{IPA|fy|/kɛi̯n/}} ===Adjective=== {{head|fy|adjective}} # [[pretty]], [[charming]] # [[chaste]] ====Inflection==== {{fy-infl-adj}} ====Further reading==== * {{R:WFT|48519}}
